title: IRCTC Down? Passengers Unable To Book Tatkal Tickets Amid Massive Outage - Times Now
summary:
IRCTC Experiences Major Outage, Leaving Passengers Unable to Book Tatkal Tickets

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Times Now

The IRCTC application and website experienced a significant outage on Thursday, preventing many passengers from booking tickets during peak hours.

  • The outage was reported widely on social media, with many users expressing frustration.
  • Downdetector indicated a spike in outage reports for the IRCTC platform.
  • This is the second major outage in December, following a previous maintenance issue on December 9.
  • Tatkal booking for AC classes starts at 10 AM and for non-AC classes at 11 AM, making the timing crucial for many travelers.
“India reached the moon, but the Indian Railways ticket booking app can't handle Tatkal booking without crashing. It's 2024, and a stable server shouldn't be rocket science!”

Passengers are calling for improvements and accountability from IRCTC regarding the recurring issues with the ticket booking system.
newTitle: IRCTC Experiences Major Outage, Leaving Passengers Unable to Book Tatkal Tickets

title: NTPC Green Energy shares in focus as 1-month lock-in period ends today - The Economic Times
summary:
NTPC Green Energy Shares Decline as Lock-In Period Ends

Publication Date: Today Source: The Economic Times

Shares of NTPC Green Energy fell up to 3% on Thursday to a low of Rs 128.25 as the 1-month shareholder lock-in period expired, allowing 183 million shares to trade in the market.

  • 183 million shares, representing about 2% of total outstanding shares, became eligible for trading.
  • The lock-in period is meant to stabilize stock prices by preventing sudden sell-offs from major investors.
  • Typically lasting six months but sometimes up to a year, the lock-in period supports a company’s long-term growth.
“This often leads to a temporary increase in selling pressure, potentially causing a drop in stock price.”

On Tuesday, NTPC Green Energy shares closed 1% lower at Rs 133.10 on the BSE.
newTitle: NTPC Green Energy Shares Decline as Lock-In Period Ends

summary:
India's Currently 'Bearish' Defence Stocks Poised For 2025 Comeback

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

India's listed defence firms are expected to recover after a significant selloff, primarily due to valuation concerns. Analysts believe that solid order books and government policies aimed at promoting local manufacturing could drive growth in 2025.

  • Many defence stocks entered a 'bearish zone' after substantial declines, notably Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd. and Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd.
  • Stocks like Cochin Shipyard Ltd. also saw declines of over 10%.
  • Government initiatives, including import restrictions and indigenous content mandates, are anticipated to boost growth.
  • Order inflows are projected to increase sharply in financial year 2025 as the government seeks to meet defence expenditure targets.
  • JPMorgan forecasts significant long-term growth potential in India's defence sector, driven by a strong push for domestic manufacturing.
“The Indian defence sector is a promising avenue for long-term structural growth.” - JPMorgan

The anticipated recovery in India's defence stocks is supported by robust government policies and increasing private sector involvement, suggesting positive long-term prospects for the industry.
newTitle: India's Defence Stocks Set for 2025 Recovery After Valuation Corrections

title: Kia Syros vs Tata Nexon: Price, Dimensions, Engine And Features Comparison - CarDekho
summary:
Kia Syros vs Tata Nexon: Price, Dimensions, Engine And Features Comparison

Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros has been unveiled as Kia's latest offering, aiming to compete with the longstanding popular Tata Nexon in the sub-4m SUV segment. This article provides a detailed comparison of features, specifications, and pricing for both vehicles.

  • Price Range: Kia Syros expected at Rs 9.70 to Rs 16.50 lakh, Tata Nexon between Rs 8 lakh to Rs 15.80 lakh.
  • Dimensions: Both SUVs share similar lengths, but the Syros offers a slightly larger height and boot space.
  • Powertrain Options: Each offers both petrol and diesel options, with the Nexon providing a CNG variant.
  • Features: The Syros boasts advanced technology and safety features surpassing those found in the Nexon.
The Tata Nexon is praised for its 5-star safety rating, while the Kia Syros is noted for its distinct design and luxurious features.

In conclusion, the choice between Kia Syros and Tata Nexon hinges on personal preference for features versus safety ratings. Both vehicles present strong contenders in the competitive sub-4m SUV market.
newTitle: Kia Syros vs Tata Nexon: A Comprehensive Comparison of Features and Specifications

title: Japan airlines hit by massive cyberattack, flights affected: All you need to know - The Times of India
summary:
Japan Airlines hit by massive cyberattack, flights affected: All you need to know

Date: October 26, 2023 | Source: Times of India

The cyberattack on Japan Airlines has caused significant disruptions, leading to numerous flight cancellations and delays. The incident has raised concerns about cybersecurity measures in the aviation industry.

  • Japan Airlines reported a massive cyberattack that disrupted their flight schedules.
  • Numerous flights were canceled, affecting thousands of passengers.
  • The airline is investigating the breach and working to restore its systems.
  • Authorities are concerned about the potential for similar attacks on other airlines.
“This attack highlights the vulnerabilities in our cybersecurity infrastructure,” commented an industry expert.

The recent cyberattack on Japan Airlines serves as a wake-up call for the aviation industry to bolster its cybersecurity protocols to prevent future incidents.
newTitle: Japan Airlines Experiences Major Cyberattack Affecting Flights

title: Christmas Is Celebrated As A Second Valentine's Day In Japan. Here's Why - News18
summary:
Christmas Is Celebrated As A Second Valentine's Day In Japan. Here's Why

Date: December 25, 2024
Source: News18

Christmas in Japan is not just a religious holiday but is celebrated as a second Valentine's Day with great enthusiasm, emphasizing romantic relationships. This phenomenon arose after World War II and has evolved into a uniquely Japanese tradition.

  • Japanese Christmas focuses on couples celebrating together, often through fine dining and hotel stays.
  • History shows that Christianity faced suppression in Japan for over 250 years, only gaining popularity after American cultural influence post-World War II.
  • Despite having a small Christian population, the holiday has become a significant cultural event filled with lights, decorations, and a festive atmosphere.
  • Japan's low marriage and birth rates make Christmas an important cultural boost for promoting couple togetherness.
“Christmas provides an opportunity for couples to spend quality time together.”

This unique approach to Christmas reflects Japan’s adaptation of Western influences, creating a celebration that enhances social bonds in a society facing declining marriage rates.
newTitle: Christmas in Japan: A Unique Celebration Similar to Valentine's Day

title: Tata Sons may infuse fresh funds into ecomm arm only by mid-2025 - The Economic Times
summary:
Tata Sons to Delay Fresh Funding for E-commerce Arm Until Mid-2025

Publication Date: Not specified in the article
Source: Economic Times

Tata Sons is expected to infuse the next round of capital into its e-commerce entity, Tata Digital, only by mid-2025. This delay means the company will depend on internal funding and debt financing in the interim.

  • Tata Digital is focusing on a data-driven strategy to enhance consumer connectivity.
  • Most funding for BigBasket and 1mg will be through debt, rather than equity.
  • The company has already invested over $2 billion in its super app.
  • Leadership changes are aimed at fostering accountability and performance.
  • Recent reports indicate a significant growth in Tata Digital’s revenue, despite notable losses.
"The focus is now on growth and scale... the priority is to scale up for the next level of growth." - Official statement

This delay in external funding highlights Tata Sons' commitment to sustainable growth as they navigate the competitive e-commerce landscape.
newTitle: Tata Sons to Delay Fresh Funding for E-commerce Arm Until Mid-2025

title: These 5 credit cards give cashback when you buy gadgets online | Mint - Mint
summary:
These 5 credit cards give cashback when you buy gadgets online

Date: October 2023 Source: Live Mint

Introduction

If you plan to buy electronic gadgets online, it's wise to check for credit cards that offer cashback. Certain cards are especially beneficial for gadget enthusiasts.

Key Points

  • Amazon Pay ICICI Credit Card: Offers 5% cashback for Prime members on Amazon purchases.
  • SBI Cashback Credit Card: Provides 5% cashback on all online spends, with an annual fee that can be waived.
  • HDFC Bank Millennia Credit Card: Delivers 5% cashback on popular platforms like Amazon and Flipkart.
  • Flipkart Axis Bank Credit Card: Grants 5% cashback on Flipkart purchases.
  • Axis Bank ACE Credit Card: Features 5% cashback on bill payments via Google Pay.

Key Factors to Consider

  • Spending habits align with cashback rewards.
  • Awareness of joining and annual fees.
  • Ensuring a sufficient credit limit.
  • Availability of EMI options for large purchases.

Conclusion

Selecting the right credit card can maximize your cashback on gadget purchases and provide added benefits.
newTitle: Top 5 Credit Cards for Cashback on Online Gadget Purchases

title: Steel ministry urges FinMin to hike Customs duty to counter Chinese threat - Business Standard
summary:
Steel Ministry Urges Finance Ministry to Increase Customs Duty on Finished Steel

Date: Dec 25 2024 | Source: Business Standard

The steel ministry has advocated for a significant increase in import duties to combat the influx of cheaper steel imports from China.

  • The ministry requests an increase in Customs duty from 7.5% to 15% in the upcoming budget.
  • This move aims to protect domestic steel producers from the adverse effects of rising imports.
  • Notably, imports from China accounted for 32% of total steel imports in the last financial year.
"A higher import duty, if implemented, could mitigate the adverse effects of a rise in cheaper imports of finished steel, particularly from China."

This proposal reflects the government's ongoing efforts to bolster the domestic steel industry in the face of foreign competition.
newTitle: Steel Ministry Urges Finance Ministry to Increase Customs Duty on Finished Steel

  • Brokerages view the correction as an opportunity with reduced valuations.
